review: I simply could not get it to find my router so I couldn't stream with it therefore.  After several days of trying I returned it.
author: James N. Keller

review: This device just works and works well.  It is amazing to me how my Apple TV always got hung up.  This device I just open up a movie in the Chrome browser on my laptop, and it plays, and plays well.  So Cool.
author: John Petersen

review: I had been exploring the world of streaming devices for a while now, and when I stumbled across Google Chromecast, I couldn't say no.  It works as described, and streams media content from multiple applications.  The downfall is that I have had to reset it multiple times. While this really isn't that big of a deal, it does take a bit of time getting it reconnected back to the internet. I would also love to see Amazon Instant Video  supported in the near future, and with new programs being added all the time, I could see this happening soon.  Overall, it is well worth the $35 price tag
author: Alicia

review: Works well, but very little, and I repeat, VERY LITTLE app support.  Unless you like to watch You Tube all the time or Netflix, not worth the money.  Only a small handful of apps support the Chromecast feature so you can't view photos or face book or most other stuff because they don't support being able to cast the image on the screen.
author: Jim Badders

review: We use this occasionally to Cast Youtube, it can also cast videos outside Youtube when played on our laptop in Chrome. But I haven't figured out how to Cast my phone pictures/videos. You can't even download to your PC and Cast them from Picassa.
author: Amazon Customer

review: It's a great device that works smoothly and does more than expected. Thanks google! Would recommend getting one, great for the price.
author: Celeste R. Cook

review: Installed this on my mom's Living Room TV...actually it kind of installed itself.  Very impressed so far!  I was concerned that it might be a problem because it looks like it would stick out pretty far and be chopped off or damaged in a tight installation.  However, those smart cookies included a little dongle so that wouldn't be a problem.  Good job, Google.

review: If you have Netflix and a free HDMI port on your TV, this is a must have; I have two and already have plans for a third

review: Even though it isn't a box that goes on your set top, It does everything that I want it to do except podcasts, I'm sure that this functionality is coming soon.
